intro: Clidemia crossosepala, commonly known as the broad-leaf mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the Onagraceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows on the branches of host trees. The plant has opposite, ovate to elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in cymes, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various birds and mammals. Clidemia crossosepala plays a role in nutrient cycling and provides ecological benefits to its host trees and surrounding wildlife.
